ction"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"tokenId","type":"uint256"}],"name":"terminateClaim","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"tokenId","type":"uint256"}],"name":"timeToClaimExpire","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"timeUntil","type":"uint256"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"tokenId","type":"uint256"}],"name":"tokenURI","outputs":[{"internalType":"string","name":"","type":"string"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"from","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address","name":"to","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"tokenId","type":"uint256"}],"name":"transferFrom","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[],"name":"unpause","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"author":"Michael McLaughlin","methods":{"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"Approves another address to transfer the given token ID The zero address indicates there is no approved address. There can only be one approved address per token at a given time. Can only be called by the token owner or an approved operator.","params":{"to":"address to be approved for the given token ID","tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to be approved"}},"balance(address)":{"params":{"account":"address to check the balance credited by the contract"},"return":"amount as uint256 as the balance credited to the account and available for withdrawal"},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"Gets the balance of the specified address.","params":{"owner":"address to query the balance of"},"return":"uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address"},"claimExpireTime(uint256)":{"params":{"tokenId":"uint256 defines the token in question"},"return":"expireTime uint256 defines when the claim will no longer be redeemable by the warrantee"},"createAndGuaranteeClaim(address,uint256,uint256,string,string)":{"params":{"expiresAfter":"uint256 creates a window in seconds within which a claim can be redeemed to be subesequently fulfilled.","valuation":"uint256 is the value agreed that is required to fulfill the claim at the end of its life","warrantee":"address is the new owner of the token"}},"createClaim(address,address,uint256,uint256,string,string)":{"details":"safeMint is used so integrating with a contract should be possible","params":{"expiresAfter":"holds the number of seconds after the claim is guaranteed by a warrantor that the warranty should expire","valuation":"holds the agreed upon valuation of the claim","warrantee":"address is the address that should own the token to start","warrantor":"is the address that the claim should be posted to for sale"},"return":"tokenId uint256 sends back the tokenId created"},"deposit(address)":{"params":{"account":"address to send the eth to"}},"depostClaim(uint256)":{"params":{"tokenId":"uint256 the targeted token"}},"deredeemClaim(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Can only be completed by the warrantee or warrantor. only warrantor adds extra time. transactions would be no-ops if they came from user, or at worst would waste the tx fees from the business","params":{"delayTime":"uint256 adds more time to the delay offset (in seconds)","expiryTime":"uint256 adds more time (in seconds) to the expiration decay","tokenId":"uint256 targets a token"}},"extendClaimExpiration(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"delayTime":"uint256 as the amount of time to be added to the delay time first set to zero","expiryTime":"uint256 as the amount of time to be added to the expiry time first set when the claim was created","tokenId":"uint256 as the targeted token"}},"fulfillClaim(address,uint256)":{"params":{"tokenId":"uint256 the id of the token in question","warrantee":"address to check ownership of the token (optional)"}},"fundClaim(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"only funds if the claim has not already been terminated. Otherwise it would go directly to the warrantor or the warrantee if it was redeemed. That's just confusing.","params":{"tokenId":"uint256 the token to be targeted"}},"getApproved(uint256)":{"details":"Gets the approved address for a token ID, or zero if no address set Reverts if the token ID does not exist.","params":{"tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to query the approval of"},"return":"address currently approved for the given token ID"},"guaranteeClaim(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"tokenId":"uint256 targets a specific token"}},"isApprovedForAll(address,address)":{"details":"Tells whether an operator is approved by a given owner.","params":{"operator":"operator address which you want to query the approval of","owner":"owner address which you want to query the approval of"},"return":"bool whether the given operator is approved by the given owner"},"isWarrantee(address,uint256)":{"params":{"account":"address is the address being checked against","tokenId":"uint256 ID is the token in question"},"return":"matches as bool whether the account is indeed the owner of the token"},"isWarrantor(address,uint256)":{"params":{"account":"address is the address being checked against","tokenId":"uint256 ID is the token in question"},"return":"matches as bool whether the account is indeed the warrantor of the token"},"name()":{"details":"Gets the token name.","return":"string representing the token name"},"ownerOf(uint256)":{"details":"Gets the owner of the specified token ID.","params":{"tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to query the owner of"},"return":"address currently marked as the owner of the given token ID"},"pause()":{"details":"Called by a pauser to pause, triggers stopped state."},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"postClaim(uint256,address)":{"details":"can only sell if the token is not already being sold","params":{"account":"address the buyer to pick up the claim","tokenId":"uint256 the targeted token"}},"redeemClaim(uint256)":{"params":{"tokenId":"targets a given token"}},"releaseTo(address,uint256)":{"details":"account param will, in most cases, be the sender's addressnonReentrant modifier used to prevent double spends","params":{"account":"address the account to send the eth to","amount":"uint256 the amount of eth to send to the account"}},"safeMint(address,uint256,bytes)":{"params":{"_data":"bytes a set of bytes to hold with the tokenId","to":"address the address to assign ownership of the newly minted token to","tokenId":"uint256 the id of the token to be minted"}},"safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256(\"onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)\"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator","params":{"from":"current owner of the token","to":"address to receive the ownership of the given token ID","tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to be transferred"}},"safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256(\"onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)\"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the _msgSender() to be the owner, approved, or operator","params":{"_data":"bytes data to send along with a safe transfer check","from":"current owner of the token","to":"address to receive the ownership of the given token ID","tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to be transferred"}},"setApprovalForAll(address,bool)":{"details":"Sets or unsets the approval of a given operator An operator is allowed to transfer all tokens of the sender on their behalf.","params":{"approved":"representing the status of the approval to be set","to":"operator address to set the approval"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}.     * Time complexity O(1), guaranteed to always use less than 30 000 gas."},"symbol()":{"details":"Gets the token symbol.","return":"string representing the token symbol"},"terminateClaim(uint256)":{"params":{"tokenId":"uint256 is the targeted token"}},"timeToClaimExpire(uint256)":{"params":{"tokenId":"uint256 the token in question"},"return":"timeUntil uint256 defines the number of seconds until the expireTime is met"},"tokenURI(uint256)":{"details":"Returns an URI for a given token ID. Throws if the token ID does not exist. May return an empty string.","params":{"tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to query"}},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address. Usage of this method is discouraged, use {safeTransferFrom} whenever possible. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator.","params":{"from":"current owner of the token","to":"address to receive the ownership of the given token ID","tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to be transferred"}},"unpause()":{"details":"Called by a pauser to unpause, returns to normal state."}},"title":"A digital relationship between two entities"},"userdoc":{"methods":{"balance(address)":{"notice":"Checks the balance of a given account"},"claimExpireTime(uint256)":{"notice":"provides the full timeline for a given claim's expiration"},"createAndGuaranteeClaim(address,uint256,uint256,string,string)":{"notice":"Creates and guarantees a claim"},"createClaim(address,address,uint256,uint256,string,string)":{"notice":"Create a claim by minting it yourself or any given contract"},"deposit(address)":{"notice":"Deposits eth and directly credits an account"},"depostClaim(uint256)":{"notice":"Un-posts a claim that was previously posted. If there is a disagreement, the warrantee can refuse the transfer"},"deredeemClaim(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"De-Redeems a claim. Allows for warrantee or warrantor to reset time if guarantee's submission did not meet agreement, or for any other reason"},"extendClaimExpiration(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Extend the timeline until the claim expires"},"fulfillClaim(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Warrantor can fulfill the claim for the amount agreed upon when the claim was first created."},"fundClaim(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Fund a claim"},"guaranteeClaim(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Guarantees a claim by claiming responsibility for the other side of the transaction, the warrantor also useful when being sold a warranty by another warrantor or by the warrantee"},"isWarrantee(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Makes sure that the account passed is the owner of the token"},"isWarrantor(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Makes sure that the account passed is set as the token's warrantor"},"postClaim(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Posts a claim to be picked up \"guaranteed\" by another entity"},"redeemClaim(uint256)":{"notice":"Redeems a claim such that an account is notified that it needs to be fulfilled if claim is accepted guarantee will get the funds defined in valuation back"},"releaseTo(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Releases funds credited to the sender to a given account"},"safeMint(address,uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"overwrites an internal safeMint to allow anyone to mint their own could probably be gotten rid of if a factory was used instead"},"terminateClaim(uint256)":{"notice":"Terminates the claim in question. Ends the claim completely and hands all funds over to the warrantor. disallow redeemed tokens from being terminated"},"timeToClaimExpire(uint256)":{"notice":"provides the number of seconds until the expireTime will be reached"}},"notice":"You can use this contract for basic nodes.name: createClaim

devdoc.author: Michael McLaughlin

approve(address,uint256).details: Approves another address to transfer the given token ID The zero address indicates there is no approved address. There can only be one approved address per token at a given time. Can only be called by the token owner or an approved operator.

params.to: address to be approved for the given token ID
params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to be approved

params.account: address to check the balance credited by the contract

balance(address).return: amount as uint256 as the balance credited to the account and available for withdrawal

balanceOf(address).details: Gets the balance of the specified address.

params.owner: address to query the balance of

balanceOf(address).return: uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address

params.tokenId: uint256 defines the token in question

claimExpireTime(uint256).return: expireTime uint256 defines when the claim will no longer be redeemable by the warrantee

params.expiresAfter: uint256 creates a window in seconds within which a claim can be redeemed to be subesequently fulfilled.
params.valuation: uint256 is the value agreed that is required to fulfill the claim at the end of its life
params.warrantee: address is the new owner of the token

createClaim(address,address,uint256,uint.details: safeMint is used so integrating with a contract should be possible

params.expiresAfter: holds the number of seconds after the claim is guaranteed by a warrantor that the warranty should expire
params.valuation: holds the agreed upon valuation of the claim
params.warrantee: address is the address that should own the token to start
params.warrantor: is the address that the claim should be posted to for sale

createClaim(address,address,uint256,uint.return: tokenId uint256 sends back the tokenId created

params.account: address to send the eth to

params.tokenId: uint256 the targeted token

deredeemClaim(uint256,uint256,uint256).details: Can only be completed by the warrantee or warrantor. only warrantor adds extra time. transactions would be no-ops if they came from user, or at worst would waste the tx fees from the business

params.delayTime: uint256 adds more time to the delay offset (in seconds)
params.expiryTime: uint256 adds more time (in seconds) to the expiration decay
params.tokenId: uint256 targets a token

params.delayTime: uint256 as the amount of time to be added to the delay time first set to zero
params.expiryTime: uint256 as the amount of time to be added to the expiry time first set when the claim was created
params.tokenId: uint256 as the targeted token
uint256 the id of the token in question
params.warrantee: address to check ownership of the token (optional)

fundClaim(uint256,uint256).details: only funds if the claim has not already been terminated. Otherwise it would go directly to the warrantor or the warrantee if it was redeemed. That's just confusing.

params.tokenId: uint256 the token to be targeted

getApproved(uint256).details: Gets the approved address for a token ID, or zero if no address set Reverts if the token ID does not exist.

params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to query the approval of

getApproved(uint256).return: address currently approved for the given token ID

params.tokenId: uint256 targets a specific token

isApprovedForAll(address,address).details: Tells whether an operator is approved by a given owner.

params.operator: operator address which you want to query the approval of
params.owner: owner address which you want to query the approval of

isApprovedForAll(address,address).return: bool whether the given operator is approved by the given owner

params.account: address is the address being checked against
params.tokenId: uint256 ID is the token in question

isWarrantee(address,uint256).return: matches as bool whether the account is indeed the owner of the token

params.account: address is the address being checked against
params.tokenId: uint256 ID is the token in question

isWarrantor(address,uint256).return: matches as bool whether the account is indeed the warrantor of the token

ownerOf(uint256).details: Gets the owner of the specified token ID.

params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to query the owner of

ownerOf(uint256).return: address currently marked as the owner of the given token ID

pause().details: Called by a pauser to pause, triggers stopped state.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

postClaim(uint256,address).details: can only sell if the token is not already being sold

params.account: address the buyer to pick up the claim
params.tokenId: uint256 the targeted token
targets a given token

releaseTo(address,uint256).details: account param will, in most cases, be the sender's addressnonReentrant modifier used to prevent double spends

params.account: address the account to send the eth to
params.amount: uint256 the amount of eth to send to the account

params._data: bytes a set of bytes to hold with the tokenId
params.to: address the address to assign ownership of the newly minted token to
params.tokenId: uint256 the id of the token to be minted

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256("onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator

params.to: address to receive the ownership of the given token ID
params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to be transferred

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256("onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the _msgSender() to be the owner, approved, or operator

params._data: bytes data to send along with a safe transfer check
params.to: address to receive the ownership of the given token ID
params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to be transferred

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).details: Sets or unsets the approval of a given operator An operator is allowed to transfer all tokens of the sender on their behalf.

params.approved: representing the status of the approval to be set
params.to: operator address to set the approval

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: See {IERC165-supportsInterface}.     * Time complexity O(1), guaranteed to always use less than 30 000 gas.

params.tokenId: uint256 is the targeted token
uint256 the token in question

timeToClaimExpire(uint256).return: timeUntil uint256 defines the number of seconds until the expireTime is met

tokenURI(uint256).details: Returns an URI for a given token ID. Throws if the token ID does not exist. May return an empty string.

params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to query

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address. Usage of this method is discouraged, use {safeTransferFrom} whenever possible. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator.

params.to: address to receive the ownership of the given token ID
params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to be transferred

unpause().details: Called by a pauser to unpause, returns to normal state.

devdoc.title: A digital relationship between two entities

balance(address).notice: Checks the balance of a given account

claimExpireTime(uint256).notice: provides the full timeline for a given claim's expiration

createClaim(address,address,uint256,uint.notice: Create a claim by minting it yourself or any given contract

deposit(address).notice: Deposits eth and directly credits an account

depostClaim(uint256).notice: Un-posts a claim that was previously posted. If there is a disagreement, the warrantee can refuse the transfer

deredeemClaim(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: De-Redeems a claim. Allows for warrantee or warrantor to reset time if guarantee's submission did not meet agreement, or for any other reason

extendClaimExpiration(uint256,uint256,ui.notice: Extend the timeline until the claim expires

fulfillClaim(address,uint256).notice: Warrantor can fulfill the claim for the amount agreed upon when the claim was first created.

guaranteeClaim(uint256,uint256).notice: Guarantees a claim by claiming responsibility for the other side of the transaction, the warrantor also useful when being sold a warranty by another warrantor or by the warrantee

isWarrantee(address,uint256).notice: Makes sure that the account passed is the owner of the token

isWarrantor(address,uint256).notice: Makes sure that the account passed is set as the token's warrantor

postClaim(uint256,address).notice: Posts a claim to be picked up "guaranteed" by another entity

redeemClaim(uint256).notice: Redeems a claim such that an account is notified that it needs to be fulfilled if claim is accepted guarantee will get the funds defined in valuation back

releaseTo(address,uint256).notice: Releases funds credited to the sender to a given account

safeMint(address,uint256,bytes).notice: overwrites an internal safeMint to allow anyone to mint their own could probably be gotten rid of if a factory was used instead

terminateClaim(uint256).notice: Terminates the claim in question. Ends the claim completely and hands all funds over to the warrantor. disallow redeemed tokens from being terminated

timeToClaimExpire(uint256).notice: provides the number of seconds until the expireTime will be reached

userdoc.notice: You can use this contract for basic warranties
